metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0293 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The SSLv2 implementation in OpenSSL before 0.9.8zf, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0r, 1.0.1 before 1.0.1m, and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2a allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (s2_lib.c assertion failure and daemon exit) via a crafted CLIENT-MASTER-KEY message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0293` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.1 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu11
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu11').
